text: Has anyone noticed files disappearing in the beta editor? Look at ```Coded files/Custom/blog/web_page_basic``` in each of these screens.
<@U26DA9CQ0> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U26DA9CQ0/FB26T1V71/screen_shot_2018-06-04_at_9.42.06_am.png|Screen Shot 2018-06-04 at 9.42.06 AM.png>
<@U26DA9CQ0> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U26DA9CQ0/FB26T4RSB/screen_shot_2018-06-04_at_9.42.32_am.png|Screen Shot 2018-06-04 at 9.42.32 AM.png>

I have seen  files vanish from the file tree before

Try this <@U26DA9CQ0> use the search in design manager 2. Your file likely is still there, just not in the tree.

The cause of this issue seems to be when you delete a folder in design manager 2, then moving something into the deleted folder after the fact.

This can easily happen when you’re copying modules from portal to portal.

Creates a weird situation where your module/template/files are floating in outerspace.

<@U9WG7DMHB> helped me previously when that happened a while back. (just tagging you just because you likely remember the issue and might be able to help better than another HS dev because of it)

Thanks Jon, that could certainly be the case, we’re inheriting this code and it’s a little messy. They don’t show up in the search. I submitted a ticket because the changes to those templates weren’t taking effect on the site.
Thanks Jon for tagging me. <@U26DA9CQ0> I'm happy to take a look at what's going on if you give me more details on which portal this is and which template is missing. could you DM me that info?

*Shopify Integration*

I have a website on <http://www.clientX.com|www.clientX.com>
I have a shopify <http://clientX.myshopify.com|clientX.myshopify.com>

Is it possible to change DNS on Shopify to have the eCommerce on the main domain <http://www.clientX.Com|www.clientX.Com> ?

Does anyone know if the standard RSS Module is broken right now? Lost all summary text on multiple sites in exactly the same way that I noticed today. Just want to make sure I’m not losing my mind LOL

Who <!here>  :sparkling_heart:LOVES:sparkling_heart: developer-specific programs? :point_right: We at HubSpot are working on a few *NEW developer-specific programs* and would love developer feedback and to get them involved early. If you're interested, please direct message me for details. :pray:
(yes, I know (at)Here is a bit dramatic, but this is exciting stuff anyone who codes on HubSpot CMS should know about)
I would think HubSpot Employees get to use those commands with no issue :wink:

Hard to compete with the post from Luke, but I’ll give it a try:
Anyone here who have tried to migrate content from one HubSpot portal to another?
We have a massive amount og blogposts, landing pages and website pages in 3 Pro portals that we need to merge and migrate to a forth. Have that been done? And how?

I second AJ on that, I think HS employees get to use it with reckless abandon. Usually you guys aren’t noisy with it, and use it to post truly helpful or interesting stuff.

That said I would like details.

Hey Guys. Is there a reason why these CTA scripts are not minifying ? <https://cta-service-cms2.HubSpot.com/ctas/v2/public/cs/loader-v2.js?__hsfp=2026382417&__hssc=134537006.1.1528139584752&__hstc=134537006.81f04695664b9dc054b5f524eb53b5a4.1528139584749.1528139584750.1528139584751.1&canon=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.creditcanada.com%2F&hsutk=81f04695664b9dc054b5f524eb53b5a4&pageId=5541106505&pg=ec8108f9-627a-4dd2-9043-15ceaae02224&pid=2686942&sv=static-1.157&lag=88&rdy=1&cos=1&df=a>

<@U7V9DQ31P> has a great tutorial on migrating blogs from HubSpot to WordPress, and you could use the same steps he uses to create a csv file for import in the new portal. Not sure the best way to do landing and site pages, but first thought would be utilizing the APIs. Would be a huge hassle though, so you might have to weigh the time it would take to write a script vs how long it would take to manually copy and paste according to how many pages you have.

haha, thanks gentlemen - I know we're all busy and don't want to be annoying. So I try to not use it much unless it directly affects someone, would be helpful, and they should have an opportunity to know about it :slightly_smiling_face:
<@U4W3K9UEQ> I’m pretty sure that you’ll need a HubSpot tech to do a data transfer like that. At least that’s what we did a couple of years ago with a client.
Thanks Mark - <@U7V9DQ31P> do you have a link perhaps :wink:
<@U26DA9CQ0>, you mean from HubSpot?
Correct.
<https://stefenphelps.com/migrate-HubSpot-blog-to-wordpress/>
speaking of this issue, surprised Slack doesn’t have a “allow only people at this domain to use @shouting commands”
At one point they did have some permissions, but a few days ago I looked to set that up for this group and didn't see them anymore. I'll reach out the slack support and see what's up

the really killer idea though I think when it comes to @shouting would be if when you try to submit your message it pops up a modal saying “Do you really want to yell at 491 people?” with a button that looks like a switch under a glass box, that on hover shows the glass box open and text appears saying “I am prepared for the 15 messages and the emojii notification spam complaining not to use this feature here.”
<@U6GNQ7JBU>
Bump
not sure, but the folks responsible for this are in Europe and it’s pretty late there. I’ll ping them in the morning if they don’t catch this on their own
